Subjective: Spot on neck x2 weeks. Onset: after shaving (small wound) and/or insect bite. Itches, swollen, redder, scabs fall off. No pain. No similar spots. Family Hx: paternal grandfather/uncles with sun-related skin problems (actinic keratosis, SCC, BCC, melanoma mentioned, but patient unsure of specific diagnosis). ICE: Worried about skin cancer (researched online, Google Lens/AI suggested serious forms for elderly, but patient not >70). Wants it removed. Left knee pain x few months, after running, lingers days, not severe. Able to play soccer. No impact on daily life for neck spot.
Objective: Neck: Raised lesion, ~0.5 cm, pinkish-red, redder in center. No scab visible. No lymphadenopathy. Other neck skin: freckles. Knee: Not examined.
Assessment: Neck lesion, etiology unclear (possible pyogenic granuloma, atypical mole, insect bite reaction). Ruled out: Warts, serious skin cancer (patient's concern). Left knee pain, likely musculoskeletal.
Plan: 1. Photo of neck lesion with centimeter scale for e-consult to dermatologist.
2. Patient to call clinic Friday for dermatologist advice.
3. Doctor to call patient Friday (preferred: before 10:00 or after 15:00).
4. Discussed removal options: freezing (patient preference), complete excision (with tissue analysis), scraping (with tissue analysis).
5. Advised separate appointment for left knee pain.
